subject: RE: [junit] Re: Help plz...
msgSnippet: ... Huh? If the C++ program takes 10 seconds, how much is 100% of that? What would it give you if the Java version where slower by that amount? Perplexed, Ilja
messageBody:
Jim Dixon wrote:

>> The typical result is that latest jdk (1.4) are 30%-100% slower than
>> c/c++ code.
>
> 100% slower? You mean, I assume, that when you run C++ the
> Java is too embarassed to run at all?

Huh?

If the C++ program takes 10 seconds, how much is 100% of that? What
would it give you if the Java version where slower by that amount?

Perplexed, Ilja
